antiPatterns.name: Hard-Coded Endpoints
antiPatterns.description: Hardcoded IP addresses and ports are used to define endpoints of required services.
antiPatterns.consequences: Services connected via hardcoded endpoints may cause unnecessary amounts of effort when service locations or the number of service instances frequently changes.
antiPatterns.solution: Adopt a dynamic service discovery approach via the service registry pattern.
sources: @article{taibi2018definition, title={On the Definition of Microservice Bad Smells}, author={Taibi, Davide and Lenarduzzi, Valentina}, journal={IEEE software}, volume={35}, number={3}, pages={56--62}, year={2018}, publisher={IEEE}, doi={10.1109/ms.2018.2141031}}
